description:
9. What is the Ministry of Health doing to prevent introduction of Ebola
into country?
title: 9. What is the Ministry of Health doing to prevent introduction of Ebola into country?
content:
- In case an ill passenger enters Kenya, the Ministry of Health has procedures in place
to protect against further spread of disease. These include:
 - Establishment of collaborative platform between Kenya Government and the affected
countries to ensure proper screening of all passengers at the airports.
 - Screening passengers to identify any cases early.
 - Notification to Ministry of health-port health services about ill passengers on a plane before arrival 
 - Investigation and isolation of ill travelers.
 - The Ministry has prepared isolation facilities at Kenyatta National Hospital for management of any
cases.
 - MOH has provided guidelines to airlines for managing ill passengers and crew, and also disinfecting
aircrafts.
 - Health workers have also been prepared to manage any possible cases as well as taking steps to
prevent the spread of this virus.
